tabs.title: 1.0: Zones in a building
tabs.query:
PREFIX inst: <http://example.org/botTest#>
PREFIX bot:  <https://w3id.org/bot#>

CONSTRUCT
WHERE {
  ?site a bot:Site ; ?a ?b .
  ?building a bot:Building ; ?c ?d .
  ?storey a bot:Storey ; ?e ?f .
  ?space a bot:Space ; ?g ?h .
}
tabs.description:
In BOT every conceptual object that can be spatially defined is a `bot:Zone`

![alt text](./assets/zones.png "Zones can be contained in other zones transitively")

tabs.title: 1.1: Zones in a building
tabs.description:
This is a simple dataset containing a building site, a building, two storeys and four spaces.

#### ABox
`inst:SiteA` is a `bot:Site` and it `bot:hasBuilding` `inst:BuildingA` which is a `bot:Building`. There are two storeys `inst:Storey00` and `inst:Storey01` and they are related to the building by the `bot:hasStorey` relationship.

#### TBox
The TBox is the full BOT ontology without human readable labels and comments.

### Query
The query returns the objects and literals that are directly connected to `inst:SiteA`. From the results we can tell that it is a bot:Site and it has a building: `inst:BuildingA`.

tabs.title: 1.2: Zones in a building
tabs.description:
This is a simple dataset containing a building site, a building, two storeys and four spaces.

#### ABox
Same as the previous tab

#### TBox
Same as the previous tab

### Query
This time we perform the query with reasoning, and this gives us the following additional information:

* The site is not only a `bot:Site` but also a `bot:Zone` as `bot:Site` is a sub-class of `bot:Zone`.
* The site not only `bot:hasBuilding` `inst:BuildingA`, but it also `bot:containsZone` `inst:BuildingA` as `bot:hasBuilding` is a sub-property of `bot:containsZone`
* Since `bot:containsZone` is a transitive property the zones contained within these zones and so on are also indirectly contained in th zone. Therefore the site not only contains `inst:BuildingA` but also `inst:Storey00` and `inst:Storey01` (that are contained in `inst:BuildingA` and the spaces that are contained in these storeys.

tabs.title: 2.0: Building elements
tabs.query:
PREFIX inst: <http://example.org/botTest#>
PREFIX bot:  <https://w3id.org/bot#>

CONSTRUCT
WHERE {
  ?site a bot:Site ; ?a ?b .
  ?building a bot:Building ; ?c ?d .
  ?storey a bot:Storey ; ?e ?f .
  ?space a bot:Space ; ?g ?h .
}

tabs.title: 3.0: Interfaces
tabs.description:
Interfaces between two zones, an element and a zone or two elements can be quantified using the `bot:Interface` class.

In this example, interfaces are used to define heat transmission areas as an interface between a zone and it's adjacent building element.

![alt text](./assets/interfaces.png "Zones can be contained in other zones transitively")

tabs.title: 3.1: Interfaces
tabs.query:
PREFIX inst: <http://example.org/botTest#>
PREFIX bot:  <https://w3id.org/bot#>

CONSTRUCT
WHERE {
  ?space bot:adjacentElement ?el .
  ?interface bot:interfaceOf ?x .
  ?space ?sProp ?sVal .
  ?el ?eProp ?eVal .
  ?interface ?iProp ?iVal .
}
tabs.description:
BOT has the concept of interfaces, which are used to quantify any connection between two zones, a zone and an element or two elements.

In this example, interfaces are used to define heat transmission areas as an interface between a zone and it's adjacent building element.

![alt text](./assets/interfaces.png "Zones can be contained in other zones transitively")
